| Vanessa Fong | Amherst College | Only Hope, Paradise Redefined | Anthropology, Education | "One-Child Generation" - the social and psychological impact of China's one-child policy | Susan Greenhalgh (characters unknown) | Susan Greenhalgh also explores the consequences of the one-child policy on Chinese society; Quote: "The one-child policy has created unique social dynamics and challenges for the younger generation" | Martin K. Whyte (characters unknown) | Martin K. Whyte focuses on the adaptability of Chinese families to social changes, which might downplay the specific impact of the one-child policy; Quote: "Chinese families have shown remarkable resilience and adaptability in the face of rapid social change" |
